description: This Kotlin source file defines the 'ConfigFragment' class, which is an Android UI fragment responsible for displaying, editing, and saving application configuration settings related to WebSocket, MQTT, and other connection parameters.

classes.name: ConfigFragment
classes.description: An Android Fragment for configuring application network and connection settings, providing UI elements for input, validation, and persistence.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment's layout from XML when the view is created.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Initializes UI elements, pre-fills form fields with existing config, and sets button click handlers for saving and applying configuration.

methods.name: readConfig
methods.description: Reads user input from form fields, validates input, constructs an AppConfig object, and returns it if valid; shows error messages otherwise.
